greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 5n + 2.
comment: Also solutions to 3^x + 5^x == 1 mod 11. - _Cino Hilliard_, May 18 2003
Numbers ending in 2 or 7. - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Jul 08 2006
For n > 2, also the number of (not necessarily maximum) cliques in the n-gear graph. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Nov 29 2017

Also, positive integers k such that 10*k+5 is equal to the product of two integers ending with 5. Proof: if 10*k+5 = (10*a+5) * (10*b+5), then k = 10*a*b + 5*(a+b) + 2 = 5 * (a + b + 2*a*b) + 2, of the form 5m + 2. So, 262 is a term because 2625 = 35 * 75. - _Bernard Schott_, May 15 2019
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-1).
maple: a[1]:=2:for n from 2 to 100 do a[n]:=a[n-1]+5 od: seq(a[n], n=1..47); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Mar 16 2008
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(2 + 3 x)/(-1 + x)^2, {x, 0, 20}], x] (* _Eric W. Weisstein_, Nov 29 2017 *)
program: (Sage) [i+2 for i in range(235) if gcd(i,5) == 5] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 20 2009
xref: Cf. A053742 (product of two integers ending with 5).
Cf. A324298 (similar with product of two integers ending with 6).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
